title: Ruth Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Ruth with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 4 chapters.

questions.question: Where did Elimelech and his family go to sojourn because of a famine?
questions.explanation: Elimelech and his family went to the country of Moab to sojourn due to famine in their land.

questions.question: What was the name of Naomi's husband?
questions.explanation: Naomi's husband's name was Elimelech.

questions.question: How many sons did Elimelech and Naomi have?
questions.explanation: They had two sons named Mahlon and Chilion.

questions.question: Who were the wives of Naomi's sons?
questions.explanation: The two sons took wives of the women of Moab, named Ruth and Orpah.

questions.question: True or False: Both of Naomi's sons died while in Moab.
questions.explanation: Both Mahlon and Chilion died while they were in Moab.

questions.question: What prompted Naomi to return to Bethlehem from Moab?
options: She heard the LORD had provided bread
questions.correctAnswer: She heard the LORD had provided bread
questions.explanation: Naomi heard in Moab that the LORD had visited His people by giving them bread, prompting her return.

questions.question: What did Naomi ask her daughters-in-law to do when she decided to return to Judah?
questions.explanation: Naomi told Orpah and Ruth to return to their mother's house.

questions.question: Which daughter-in-law chose to stay with Naomi?
questions.explanation: Ruth clung to Naomi and chose to stay with her.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Thy people shall be my people, and thy God my ____.'
questions.explanation: Ruth pledged that Naomi's God would be her God.

questions.question: What new name did Naomi ask to be called upon her return to Bethlehem?
questions.explanation: Naomi said to call her Mara, meaning bitter, because of her hardships.

questions.question: Who was Boaz in relation to Naomi's deceased husband?
questions.explanation: Boaz was a kinsman of Elimelech, Naomi's husband.

questions.question: True or False: Ruth asked Naomi for permission to glean in the fields.
questions.explanation: Ruth sought Naomi's permission before going to glean in the fields.

questions.question: In whose field did Ruth happen to glean?
questions.explanation: Ruth gleaned in the field of Boaz, a relative of Elimelech.

questions.question: What greeting did Boaz give to his reapers?
questions.explanation: Boaz greeted the reapers saying, 'The LORD be with you.'

questions.question: How did Boaz instruct his young men concerning Ruth?
options: Not to touch her and to let her glean among the sheaves
questions.correctAnswer: Not to touch her and to let her glean among the sheaves
questions.explanation: Boaz commanded his young men to leave grain for Ruth and not to touch her.

questions.question: True or False: Ruth gleaned until evening and gathered about an ephah of barley.
questions.explanation: Ruth gleaned all day and gathered about an ephah of barley.

questions.question: What did Naomi say about Boaz’s kindness toward Ruth?
options: He has not left off kindness to the living and the dead
He is only kind to the living
questions.correctAnswer: He has not left off kindness to the living and the dead
questions.explanation: Naomi acknowledged Boaz's kindness to both living and dead.

questions.question: What advice did Naomi give Ruth concerning Boaz's maidens?
options: Stay with them till the harvest ends
questions.correctAnswer: Stay with them till the harvest ends
questions.explanation: Naomi advised Ruth to glean with Boaz's maidens until harvest was finished.

questions.question: What did Naomi ask Ruth to do at the threshingfloor at night?
options: Uncover Boaz's feet and lie down
Go to sleep in another place
questions.correctAnswer: Uncover Boaz's feet and lie down
questions.explanation: Naomi instructed Ruth to uncover Boaz's feet and lie down after he had eaten and drunk.

questions.question: True or False: Ruth was afraid to follow Naomi's plan at the threshingfloor.
questions.explanation: Ruth agreed and did according to all Naomi commanded.

questions.question: What was Boaz's reaction when he awoke and found Ruth at his feet?
options: He was afraid and asked who she was
questions.correctAnswer: He was afraid and asked who she was
questions.explanation: Boaz was afraid and asked Ruth who she was when he awoke.

questions.question: What did Ruth request from Boaz upon revealing herself?
options: To spread his skirt over her
questions.correctAnswer: To spread his skirt over her
questions.explanation: Ruth asked Boaz to spread his skirt over her, symbolizing protection as a kinsman.

questions.question: True or False: Boaz said Ruth showed more kindness in the latter end than at the beginning.
questions.explanation: Boaz praised Ruth's kindness shown later more than earlier.

questions.question: Who did Boaz say was a nearer kinsman than himself?
questions.explanation: Boaz acknowledged another kinsman nearer than himself who had the first right of redemption.

questions.question: What did Boaz give Ruth to take back to Naomi after their meeting?
questions.explanation: Boaz gave Ruth six measures of barley as a gift.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'These six measures of barley gave he me; for he said to me, Go not ____ unto thy mother in law.'
questions.explanation: Boaz told Ruth not to go empty-handed to Naomi.

questions.question: Where did Boaz go to meet the nearer kinsman to settle the redemption?
questions.explanation: Boaz went to the city gate where legal matters were settled to speak to the nearer kinsman.

questions.question: How many elders did Boaz bring to witness the transaction?
questions.explanation: Boaz took ten elders of the city as witnesses.

questions.question: What did Naomi sell that Boaz wanted the nearer kinsman to redeem?
questions.explanation: Naomi sold a parcel of land that belonged to Elimelech.

questions.question: Why did the nearer kinsman refuse to redeem the land and marry Ruth?
options: He didn't want to mar his own inheritance
questions.correctAnswer: He didn't want to mar his own inheritance
questions.explanation: The nearer kinsman declined lest he damage his own inheritance.

questions.question: What custom was used to confirm the redemption legally in Israel?
questions.explanation: A man would pluck off his shoe and give it to his neighbor as a testimony.

questions.question: True or False: After the nearer kinsman refused, Boaz declared he would redeem the land and marry Ruth.
questions.explanation: Boaz declared he would redeem the land and take Ruth as wife.

questions.question: What was Boaz's reason for marrying Ruth?
options: To raise up the name of the dead upon his inheritance
questions.correctAnswer: To raise up the name of the dead upon his inheritance
questions.explanation: Boaz married Ruth to preserve the name of Mahlon (her deceased husband).

questions.question: Who was the son born to Boaz and Ruth?
questions.explanation: Their son was Obed, grandfather of David.

questions.question: True or False: The women of the city praised Naomi for the birth of Obed.
questions.explanation: The women praised Naomi and said she had a son to sustain her name.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'The LORD recompense thy work, and a full reward be given thee of the LORD God of Israel, under whose ____ thou art come to trust.'
questions.explanation: Boaz told Ruth she had come under the wings of the LORD God of Israel.

questions.question: What was Ruth's nationality before she came to Bethlehem?
questions.explanation: Ruth was a Moabite woman who came with Naomi from Moab.

questions.question: True or False: Naomi expressed bitterness because she felt the LORD had afflicted her.
questions.explanation: Naomi said the LORD had dealt very bitterly with her.

questions.question: What season was it when Ruth and Naomi returned to Bethlehem?
questions.explanation: They returned at the beginning of the barley harvest.

questions.question: How did Ruth describe her commitment to Naomi?
options: I will follow you for a season
Thy people shall be my people, and thy God my God
I will return to my people
I will serve you only while I live
questions.correctAnswer: Thy people shall be my people, and thy God my God
questions.explanation: Ruth declared her loyalty to Naomi's people and God.

questions.question: True or False: Boaz praised Ruth for not seeking after young men, poor or rich.
questions.explanation: Boaz commended Ruth for her loyalty and virtue.

questions.question: What was the reaction of the city when Ruth and Naomi arrived?
options: The city was moved about them and asked, Is this Naomi?
questions.correctAnswer: The city was moved about them and asked, Is this Naomi?
questions.explanation: The arrival of Naomi and Ruth caused a stir in Bethlehem.
